item.title: Week 21 - 2023
item.description: 108 paper planes with multipel variations flying in the sky grow Beej’s Guide to Network Programming (beej.us) | [üí¨ discussion] - Hello, one and all! This is my little how-to guide on network programming using Internet sockets, or “sockets programming”, for those of you who prefer it. The sockets API, though started by the Berkeley folk, has been ported to many many platforms, including Unix, Linux, and even Windows. { #networking #learning }
item.content:
grow

Beej’s Guide to Network Programming (beej.us) | [üí¨ discussion] - Hello, one and all! This is my little how-to guide on network programming using Internet sockets, or “sockets programming”, for those of you who prefer it. The sockets API, though started by the Berkeley folk, has been ported to many many platforms, including Unix, Linux, and even Windows. { #networking #learning }

Memory Allocation (samwho.dev) | [üí¨ discussion] - In this post I’m going to introduce you to the basics of memory allocation. Allocators exist because it’s not enough to have memory available, you need to use it effectively. We will visually explore how simple allocators work. We’ll see some of the problems that they try to solve, and some of the techniques used to solve them. At the end of this post, you should know everything you need to know to write your own allocator. { #coding #memory #learning }

The Open Buddhist University @ A website dedicated to providing free, online courses and bibliographies in Buddhist Studies. (buddhistuniversity.net) | [üí¨ discussion] - The Open Buddhist University is an unaccredited, digital resource run by Khemarato Bhikkhu since 2020. { #buddhism }

Modern work requires attention. Constant alerts steal it - Stack Overflow Blog (stackoverflow.blog) | [üí¨ discussion] - Attention‚Äîthe time and freedom to focus‚Äîis your team‚Äôs most valuable resource. { #attention }

tech

ClipBase - Search Audio & Video Clips by Words or Phrase (clipbase.xyz) | [üí¨ discussion] - Search millions of audio & video clips by word or phrase… { #youtube #search }

Nyxt browser: The hacker’s browser (nyxt.atlas.engineer) | [üí¨ discussion] - Out of the box Nyxt ships with tens of features that allow you to quickly analyze, navigate, and extract information from the Internet. Plus, Nyxt is fully hackable- all of its source code can be introspected, modified, and tweaked to your exact specification. { #browser }

misc

American Discovery Trail ‚Ñ¢ | Making Connections ‚Äì the first coast to coast non-motorized trail (discoverytrail.org) - The American Discovery Trail creates a coast to coast route across the USA connecting people with rural and urban areas, wilderness, desert mountains and forests, with other trails, and with each other. { #trail #hiking }

Fold ‘N Fly ¬ª Paper Airplane Folding Instructions (foldnfly.com) | [üí¨ discussion] - A database of paper airplanes with easy to follow folding instructions, video tutorials and printable folding plans. Find the best paper airplanes that fly the furthest and stay aloft the longest. Learn how to make paper airplanes that will impress your friends. { #craft #fun }

I Get No Mail and It‚Äôs Glorious - by David Friedman (ironicsans.substack.com) - Unsubscribe junk mails { #mail #spam }

item.title: Week 18 - 2023
item.description: alien-tech fountain pen grow The web’s most important decision - The History of the Web (thehistoryoftheweb.com) | [üí¨ discussion] - Thirty years ago, Tim Berners-Lee and CERN gave the world a gift. After some internal discussions, CERN stamped (quite literally) its approval on a document, relinquishing all intellectual property rights to the World Wide Web and entering it into the public domain. { #web #learn } üé¨ watch video | [üìù text-summary] (youtu.
item.content:
grow

The web’s most important decision - The History of the Web (thehistoryoftheweb.com) | [üí¨ discussion] - Thirty years ago, Tim Berners-Lee and CERN gave the world a gift. After some internal discussions, CERN stamped (quite literally) its approval on a document, relinquishing all intellectual property rights to the World Wide Web and entering it into the public domain. { #web #learn }

üé¨ watch video | [üìù text-summary] (youtu.be) - Kevin Kelly ‚Äî Excellent Advice for Living | The Tim Ferriss Show { #ai #wisdom }

Anthropologist pair solve the mystery of Mayan 819-day count (phys.org) | [üí¨ discussion] - The Mayan calendar might represent a longer timescale than previously considered { #ancient }

Explained from First Principles (explained-from-first-principles.com) - Welcome to Explained from First Principles, a technology, science, and philosophy blog for curious people who want to understand and change the world. In order to make you feel at home here as quickly as possible, here is what you should know about this blog. { #learning }

Feynman‚Äôs Maze-Running Story ¬∑ Gwern.net (gwern.net) | [üí¨ discussion] - Richard Feynman recounts an amazing anecdote about philosophy of science; we trace it to a forgotten University of Michigan research programme into ‚Äòfloor cues‚Äô. { #feynman }

How companies use dark patterns to keep you subscribed (pudding.cool) | [üí¨ discussion] - I unsubscribed from 16 online services and documented the ways companies made it, knowingly (or unknowingly), challenging. { #dark-pattern }

macOS Internals ¬∑ GitHub (gist.github.com) | [üí¨ discussion] - Understand your Mac and iPhone more deeply by tracing the evolution of Mac OS X from prelease to Swift. John Siracusa delivers the details. { #mac }

tech

Google Cache Search: View Cached Pages & Websites (clickminded.com) - The Google cache search tool will let you easily view cached pages and websites in Google’s search index. You’ll be able to view the content of the page as it was last cached. This is great for a number of things, like checking when Google last indexed a page you’ve recently updated, or finding old content that you might need. { #tool }

GitHub - Textualize/frogmouth: A Markdown browser for your terminal (github.com) | [üí¨ discussion] - A Markdown browser for your terminal { #tool }

switching.software | Ethical, easy-to-use and privacy-conscious alternatives to well-known software (switching.software) - Ethical, easy-to-use and privacy-conscious alternatives to well-known software { #oss }

Opt out of global data surveillance programs like PRISM, XKeyscore, and Tempora - PRISM Break - PRISM Break (prism-break.org) | [üí¨ discussion] - Help make mass surveillance of entire populations uneconomical! We all have a right to privacy, which you can exercise today by encrypting your communications and ending your reliance on proprietary services. { #privacy #tool }

Privacy Guides: Your Independent Privacy and Security Resource (privacyguides.org) | [üí¨ discussion] - The guide to restoring your online privacy. Massive organizations are monitoring your online activities. Privacy Guides is your central privacy and security resource to protect yourself online. { #privacy }

Free for Developers (free-for.dev) - Developers and Open Source authors now have a massive amount of services offering free tiers, but it can be hard to find them all to make informed decisions. This is a list of software (SaaS, PaaS, IaaS, etc.) and other offerings that have free tiers for developers. { #tool #free }

Passkeys: What they are and how to use them (blog.google) | [üí¨ discussion] - For the first time, we‚Äôve begun rolling out passkeys, the easiest and most secure way to sign in to apps and websites and a major step toward a ‚Äúpasswordless future.‚Äù { #password }

Argus (release-argus.io) | [üí¨ discussion] - Argus provides a way for you to monitor the versions of software and trigger alerts when a new release is been found. { #tool #monitoring }

Grasp | New kind of search engine (usegrasp.com) | [üí¨ discussion] - Grasp is a search engine for your personal network of high-quality websites. { #tool #search }

GitHub - ellie/atuin: üê¢ Magical shell history (github.com) | [üí¨ discussion] - üê¢ Magical shell history { #tool #cli }

misc

Ten classic fountain pens for the personal touch | Wallpaper (wallpaper.com) | [üí¨ discussion] - Ten fountain pens, from timeless designs to sleekly machined modern writing tools, prove that perfect penmanship is just a gold nib away { #writing #pen }

Eyecandy - Visual Technique Library (eycndy.com) | [üí¨ discussion] - a visual technique library for visual technique lovers { #gif }

it’s a(door)able (ncase.me) | [üí¨ discussion] - fun game { #game }

TV series about startup failures, portraying their greedy founders, and the damages of the current startup ecosystem | 1984.design (1984.design) | [üí¨ discussion] - TV series about startup failures, portraying their greedy founders, and the damages of the current startup ecosystem { #tv #startup }

Anonymous Tor Phone (0ut3r.space) | [üí¨ discussion] - I was always curious about all that bad guys (criminals, drug dealers, hitman‚Äôs, thief‚Äôs etc.) using not very good and secure communication channels. Forgetting about whole OPSEC stuff. { #privacy #tor }
